meanings.definition: Lacking in variety or interest; dull
meanings.sent1: The movie was so monotonous that I fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent2: His monotonous voice made it hard to stay focused during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The monotonous hum of the air conditioner became the soundtrack of our boring day.
meanings.sent4: Her monotonous routine felt like walking in circles with no end in sight.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous gray sky seemed to stretch on forever, matching my mood perfectly.

meanings.definition: Continuing in an unchanging tone; lacking in inflection or modulation
meanings.sent1: The robot's monotonous voice repeated the same message over and over.
meanings.sent2: The singer's monotonous performance failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: Listening to the monotonous beeping of the alarm clock was like torture.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous sound of rain tapping on the window created a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous ticking of the clock echoed through the empty room, emphasizing the silence.
